intro: Mariscus maculatus, commonly known as the spotted mariscus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, typically arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
